question: [Customer Obsession LP] Which action best demonstrates Customer Obsession? (Unique ID: 1)

options.A: Focusing primarily on competitor pricing.
options.B: Prioritizing short-term revenue goals over long-term customer trust.
options.C: Working backwards from the customer need.
options.D: Designing a feature based on internal engineering convenience.

explanation: Working backwards from the customer need is the core tenet of Customer Obsession, ensuring all efforts begin with solving the customer's problem.

question: [Ownership LP] You notice an error in a cross-team project's documentation. Which response aligns with Ownership? (Unique ID: 2)

options.A: Report it to the document owner and wait for their action.
options.B: Fix the error immediately and notify the owner.
options.C: Ignore it, as it's not your team's responsibility.
options.D: Log a bug ticket and set the priority to low.

explanation: Ownership means acting on behalf of the entire company, not just your team. Fixing the error shows personal accountability for quality, even if it's outside your direct domain.

question: [Invent and Simplify LP] When is the best time to 'Invent and Simplify' a process? (Unique ID: 3)

options.A: Only when a competitor introduces a better solution.
options.B: Continuously, regardless of current process success.
options.C: When stakeholders complain about efficiency.
options.D: Never, as existing processes are proven reliable.

explanation: This principle emphasizes continuous innovation. Leaders constantly look for new ways to do things and simplify complex processes, even if the current system is functional.

question: [Hire and Develop the Best LP] A great leader performing well on 'Hire and Develop the Best' is characterized by: (Unique ID: 4)

options.A: Delegating all training responsibilities to HR.
options.B: Being a hiring gatekeeper to prevent top talent from leaving.
options.C: Recognizing exceptional talent and proactively coaching them towards promotion.
options.D: Focusing only on high-volume hiring to meet growth targets.

explanation: Leaders raise the performance bar. This includes actively identifying, mentoring, and coaching high-potential talent to ensure their continuous growth and readiness for the next level.

options.A: Report it to the document owner and wait for their action.
options.B: Fix the error immediately and notify the owner.
options.C: Ignore it, as it's not your team's responsibility.
options.D: Log a bug ticket and set the priority to low.

explanation: Ownership means acting on behalf of the entire company, not just your team. Fixing the error shows personal accountability for quality, even if it's outside your direct domain.

question: [Invent and Simplify LP] When is the best time to 'Invent and Simplify' a process? (Unique ID: 63)

options.A: Only when a competitor introduces a better solution.
options.B: Continuously, regardless of current process success.
options.C: When stakeholders complain about efficiency.
options.D: Never, as existing processes are proven reliable.

explanation: This principle emphasizes continuous innovation. Leaders constantly look for new ways to do things and simplify complex processes, even if the current system is functional.
